newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Oct 22.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - Oct 22.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Iran and the Gulf Arab States need $160 billion to raise their daily production of oil to 37 billion barrels in 2010.
- Egyptian oil minister says political disparity with Israel will not affect gas supply plans.
- A big blaze in Savola oil plant in Bahrain causes a loss of about ten million dinars.
- Saudi Agriculture Ministry allocates 376 million riyals for 60 projects.
- Qatar's Al Rayan oil field will start working in November 1996.
